e.v: Now that's a lot of Easter eggs.
Bet you didn't think they'd be that much work, right?
You'll be amazed how much food they need.
That thing wouldn't have fit onto the street anyway.
I'm somewhat of a collector myself.
Childhood memories, brought back to your home.
Where would you even store them?!
I'm a little proud of this one myself.
The first step of any farmer.
If a tree falls in a forest and no one is around to hear it, does one hand clap?
It's a fruit, not a vegetable!
My horses are crazy for it.
The path to success is paved with rocks.
You won't rest until you've reached maximum efficiency.
A little help can go a long way.
These are the fruits of your labor.
Seriously, think of the poor animal!
Oh, they can do THAT as well?
I could get used to getting around like this…
It feels good to be home.
What do you mean "take care of my own farm as well"?
Sure, I can take care of that, neighbor.
You know you can also spend it, right?
Well you've been one busy bee, haven't you?
Ok, I might have a problem…
Yes, I need each and every one of these.
I've never felt happier than here.
Planting one bean will yield much green.
You have to think about the future.
One vehicle for all of your needs.
In it for the long game, I see.
Look at Mr. Fancypants over there.
Seriously, you should consider a membership card.
It was only a matter of time…
It's never too late to farm
Helper A does not stop … ever
I like to switch it up
This is just my weekend vehicle
Unable to change gear. Clutch pedal has to be pressed!
Unable to change gear group. Clutch pedal has to be pressed!
Train is going to arrive soon. (%s)
AI worker %s is blocked by an object!
AI worker %s not ready to drive - '%s' not in transport mode!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - field not owned!
AI worker %s has a full grain tank!
AI worker %s has a nearly full grain tank! (80%%)
AI worker %s could not start. Tool attached incorrectly.
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - loading station does not exist anymore!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - no field found!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - invalid crop for selected target!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - target is unreachable!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - tank is empty!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - fuel tank is empty!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - not enough money!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - threshing not allowed!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - unknown reason!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - unloading station does not exist anymore!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - vehicle is broken!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - vehicle was removed!
AI worker %s has stopped work unexpectedly - wrong season for this work!
AI worker %s has completed their task!
AI worker %s has completed their task! Silo is empty!
Job cannot be started. Too many active workers!
Job cannot be started. No permission!
Job cannot be started. Vehicle does not exist anymore!
Job cannot be started. Vehicle is in use!
Filltype not supported by loading station!
Filltype not supported by unloading station!
Loading station does not exist anymore!
Vehicle does not support ai discharging!
Vehicle does not support ai loading!
Unloading station does not exist anymore!
Vehicle does not support AI worker!
You cannot hire more ai workers because you already reached the limit!
This type of animal is not supported by the current livestock trailer!
Do you really want to buy %d animals (%s) for %s?
The trailer already contains a different type of animal!
Chickens require a clean feeding area.
Animals always need water! Barns have built-in water supply. Some animals also require straw.

A horse's value is determined by its fitness, health, and cleanliness. They should be ridden every day to increase their fitness. Horses require straw for clean bedding and water and food to stay healthy. Periodically they need to be brushed and cleaned.
Feed them a mix of the following foods (for best results, provide all these types):
Feed them any of the following food types (for best results, provide the most effective food type):
The pen capacity is already reached!
Could not move animal because it is in use!
This type of animal cannot be unloaded here!
Do you really want to load %d animals onto the vehicle?
You don't have a pen for this animal type!
You don't have enough money to buy these animals!
You don't have enough money to buy these animals! Do you want to buy more coins?
Do you really want to sell %d animals (%s) for %s?
The transportation vehicle is no longer available!
Do you really want to unload %d animals from the vehicle?
You found a cheese wedge! There are %d more.
You found the Fresh Fruit Farmers game cartridge! Just %d more to go!
You found the It's Harp Lifter! game cartridge! Just %d more to go!

You found the Road Race Ratooning game cartridge! Just %d more to go!
You found the Caverns of Underelm game cartridge! Just %d more to go!
You found the Wheat Gobbler game cartridge! Just %d more to go!

You found the AgriPinball DX game cartridge! Just %d more to go!

Many years ago, a software company buried their entire stock of unsold video game cartridges in this region. Try and find all of them!
You found all 10 cows! Go to Cody's toy store, maybe something has changed!
You found all 10 harvesters! Go to Cody's toy store, maybe something has changed!
You found all 10 horses! Go to Cody's toy store, maybe something has changed!
You found all 10 pigs! Go to Cody's toy store, maybe something has changed!
You found all 10 plows! Go to Cody's toy store, maybe something has changed!
You found all 10 seeders! Go to Cody's toy store, maybe something has changed!
You found all 10 sheep! Go to Cody's toy store, maybe something has changed!
You found all 10 tractors! Go to Cody's toy store, maybe something has changed!

Get the full version of Farming Simulator here.

You are not connected to a Wi-Fi network
Please reinsert the storage device with the downloadable content, or quit the game.

The vehicle shop is only accessible during the career.
Please sign in with the invited user (%s)
The Black Beauty version of the Fendt 900 Vario
The Black Anthem version of the Mack truck
Make sure to buy a pallet of %s for this contract
Mow the grass in field %d. Then dry it with a tedder and bale it. Take the bales to %s.
Mow the grass in field %d. Then bale the grass and wrap it to make silage bales. Take the bales to %s.
Prepare field %d for sowing the next crop by cultivating it.
Fertilize field %d with any type of fertilizer (liquid, solid, slurry, or manure).
Make sure to fill the tool with '%s'.
Harvest the '%s' in field %d and take the product to %s.
Plow field %d to loosen the soil and prepare it for sowing the next crop.
Remove the weeds in field %d by spraying the field with herbicide.
Use your own equipment or lease equipment for a reward reduced by %s.
Remove the small weeds in field %d using a weeder.
Are you sure you want to cancel this contract and lose all payment?
You need to deliver the '%s' to the %s
You have to rotate your chainsaw first
You are planting the wrong crop for the contract
An additional tank to increase the capacity of your tools.
A place to keep your chickens.
A place to keep your cows.
A place to keep your horses.
A place to keep your pigs.
A place to keep your sheep.
Auger wagons (also known as chaser bins) are used in the field for temporarily storing different crop types and directly unload them into other trailers.
A bale loader eases the collection of bales.
A bale trailer is used to transport bales.
A bale wrapper packs grass bales in foil so they can ferment into silage.
A baler turns loose straw, grass, or hay into convenient bales.
Bale(s) to feed your animals with.

Beehives produce honey. It will be placed at centralized location which has to be bought and placed separately. If you place beehives near fields certain crops will also have a slightly increased yield.
Location where honey generated by beehives is placed at as pallets.
Conveyor belts are an alternative way to load your trailers.
This conveyor belt transports material from one belt to the next one.
This belt will take material from the ground and load it onto the next conveyor belt.
Fresh wheat to feed your chickens with.
Bigbags are used to refill your fertilizer spreaders.
Fresh oat to feed your horses with.
This tool can be used to transport your big bags.
Bigbags are used to refill lime spreaders.
Perfectly balanced food pellets to feed your pigs.
Road salt can be used to clear the road from snow if there is not too much.
Bigbags are used to refill your sowing machines.
Bio balers are used to press poplar into bales.
With this tool, poplar can be pushed down to be taken by the BioBaler.
At this biogas station, you can refuel your methane tractors.
A bunker silo can be filled with chaff, grass or hay. After compacting and covering the silo, the content converts into silage.
Driving a car allows you to quickly travel from A to B.
You can use a chainsaw to cut down trees.
At this charging station, you can charge your electrical tractors.
Buy coins to enrich your gameplay.
This machine can harvest the indicated crop types.
Forage harvesters process the indicated crop types.
For a harvester to work, it also needs a suitable header.
For a forage harvester to work, it also needs a suitable header.
Support wheel to transport the Kemper headers on the road.
A cultivator prepares fields for the next sowing.
Headers are attached to forage harvesters.
Header trailers can transport headers safely on the road.
Decorate your farm with this lamp.
A tank used for on-farm fuel storage and used to refuel your equipment.
Disc harrows are used for shallow cultivation of fields.
Used to play with the dog.
A small shed often built in the shape of a house to shelter a dog.
A dolly serves as a link between a semitrailer and a tractor.
Silos are used to store crops.
Silos are used to store crops. You also need an auger or conveyor for this silo.
A forage mixer wagon blends silage, hay, mineral feed and straw into Total Mixed Ration (TMR) that can be fed to cows.
This machine takes straw bales and uses them to cover the ground of an animal husbandry with straw.
Fertilizer spreaders improve the harvest of your fields.
Liquid fertilizer can be poured into sprayers.
This silo can be filled with fertilizer and seeds.
This silo can be filled with fertilizer.
This silo can be filled with liquid fertilizer.
This silo can be filled with liquid fertilizer, herbicide, or water.
Poplar saplings can be planted using a tree planter.
With this pallet, you can refill sugarcane planters.
This silo can be filled with seeds.
This silo can be filled with different products.
You can light up your farm with a floodlight at night.
A forage wagon collects grass, hay, or straw. It can also be filled with chaff.
This machine can cut down trees.
Forestry mulchers can be used to remove tree stumps and bushes.
This tree planter plants new trees into the ground. You can buy pallets of saplings at the shop to fill this planter.
This vehicle can transport tree logs.
Note: Very large trees cannot be processed
This machine breaks trunks into wood chips.
Forklifts are used to stack and load various goods.
Front loaders are used to stack and load various goods.
This tool can be used to transport bales.
This tool can be used to transport logs.
This tool can be used to transport manure.
This tool can be used to transport pallets.
This tool can be used to transport round bales.
This tool can be used to load goods on your trailer.
Garage to store your vehicles and tools.
Hall to store your bulk material.
Garage with a workshop to store and repair your vehicles and tools.
Shelter with hourly income to park your vehicles and tools.
Grapevines are planted in rows and need to be cultivated, fertilized and mulched to gain the full yield. They also need to be pruned after harvesting.
Grass rollers and weeders improve the yield of your grass fields.
Produces vegetables which are sold automatically to earn you money.
This harvester digs the potatoes out of the ground. Note that a haulm topper is required prior to using this machine.
This harvester digs the potatoes out of the ground.
This self-propelled harvester collects potatoes in one go.
This self-propelled harvester collects sugar beets in one go.
This harvester digs the sugar beets out of the ground. Note that haulm topping is needed prior to using this machine.
Before potatoes can be harvested, the foliage needs to be cut with a haulm topper like this one.
Before sugar beets can be harvested, the foliage needs to be cut with a haulm topper like this one.
Storage space for hay and straw.
Dropping woodchips at this selling station produces heat and earns you money.
Herbicides can be used in sprayers to remove weeds.
With this machine, you can clean dirty vehicles and tools.
Inline wrappers are used to wrap multiple bales together to one tube.
Levelers are used to move chaff and silage and level the heaps in the silos.
Liquid fertilizer tanks are used to refill your sprayers.
These tanks are used to store liquid manure.
Increases the storage capacity of your liquid manure tank. Must be placed near your barns or liquid manure tanks.
This trailer is used to transport animals.
This machine can collect sugar beets from the ground and tips them into a trailer.
This machine collects materials from the ground and tips them into trailers.
This trailer can transport other vehicles.
Manure spreaders improve the harvest of your fields.
Can be added as part of your Total Mixed Ration (TMR) to feed your cows.
Mulchers can be used to crush the crop stubbles.
Olive groves are planted in rows and need to be cultivated, fertilized and mulched to gain the full yield.
Loading this machine with potatoes or sugar beets will create nicely packed pallets you can sell. Alternatively, it can load conveyor belts with sugar beets or potatoes.
This trailer can be used to transport your pallets.
Any logs you put into this machine are converted into wood chips that are immediately sold to the sawmill.
Planters are a special type of seeders. They are used for crops like maize, sunflowers or soybeans.
With a plow, you can prepare fields for the next sowing and create new fields.
Produces power which is sold automatically to earn you money.
Takes goods and transforms them into different products.
This vehicle is equipped with reverse drive control.
With a roller, you can improve the upper soil layer quality of your fields.
Salt spreader can be used to clear the road from snow if there is not too much.
This pallet of saplings is used to fill the tree planter.
At a selling point, you can sell your harvested and produced goods.
Semitrailers can be attached to a tractor by using a dolly.
Shallow cultivators are used for shallow cultivation or seed bed creation of fields.
With silage additives, you can increase your yield.
With a silage compactor, your silage will be compacted faster.
Increases the storage capacity of your silos. Must be placed near your farm silos.
Skid Steer Loaders are used to stack and load various goods.
A slurry container is used as an interim storage for slurry. You can fill it from other slurry tanks.
Slurry tankers are used the fertilize the field with slurry.
Slurry distributors can be attached to suitable slurry tanks.
Slurry tankers are used the fertilize the field with slurry. This tanker needs an additional distributor.
A snowplow can be used to clear your farm from snow.
Fertilizer can be filled into fertilizer spreaders.
These machines are used to seed crops like wheat, barley or canola.
Additionally, this seeder offers the possibility to seed directly (no previous cultivating or plowing is necessary).
A spader prepares fields for the next sowing. It can be used instead of a plow.
Sprayers increase the harvest output of fields.
Additional tanks increase the capacity of sprayers.
Stone pickers are used to remove stones from a field.
Silos are used to store your crops.
This machinery grinds down tree stumps.
A subsoiler prepares fields for the next sowing. It can be used instead of a plow.
This tool can cut sugar beets to feed them to your biogas plant.
This planter can be used to plant sugarcane.
Sugarcane trailers are able to tip their bins high in order to fill larger vehicles directly.
A tedder turns grass around so it can dry faster.
Telehandlers are used to stack and load various goods.
Tippers/trailers are used to transport different crop types.
Tractors are required to pull trailers and tools.
This tractor can also attach a front loader.
Trailer with a 3-point hitch for tractors without one.
With a tree saw you can cut down trees.
This tool suits perfectly for grape and olive farming.
This tractor suits perfectly for grape and olive farming.
A pre-pruner is used after the harvest to prepare the vines for the next year.
Allows you to access your wardrobe.
This supplementary watertank helps you to supply your greenhouses with water. Must be placed near greenhouses.
The water station can supply your water tanks with fresh water.
A weather station improves the weather forecast available to your farm.
Weeders pull out small grown weeds between crops, improving the field's state. They can only be used in the first growing stages of crops.
A weight helps to keep a tractor's wheels on the ground and improves its balance.
Wheel loaders are used to stack and load various goods.
Wheel weights on the tractor are recommended for use.
You can pull wood out of the forest with a winch.
A windrower arranges grass, hay, or straw in rows (windrows) that are easier to handle.
This vehicle workshop allows you to create a spot anywhere on the map where you can customize your machinery without the need for a paid mechanic.
Adding straw bedding to a cow or pig enclosure creates manure for the farm. A separate manure heap needs to be placed next to the barn via the build mode menu.
As soon as cows and pigs are fed, they produce slurry, which is collected either in a slurry tank or a pit.
You can optimize the milk production of your cows by feeding them Total Mixed Ration (TMR). TMR is produced by mixing hay, straw, silage and mineral feed together in a mixer wagon.

You have to take care of your animals: feed them, give them water and change their bedding by using a straw blower. If you have purchased an animal barn, they are automatically supplied with water. When cows, sheep, pigs and chicken are happy and old enough, they reproduce and new animals are added to your animal population.

If you want to take a break from harvesting, or if that is not your main activity, you can also take care of animals: horses, cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens. First, you need to buy an animal pen and place it via the build mode menu. Then you can purchase animals from your local animal dealer.

You can bring the animals back to the farm yourself in a livestock trailer. To do so, make sure that the trailer is parked close to the animal dealer. For a fee, the animal dealer can deliver the animals directly to your farm.

Beehives produce honey, which can be processed further or sold directly. Place your beehives next to fields and you will soon be living in the land of milk and honey as the bees will increase the yield of canola, sunflower and potato fields. Honey will be delivered to the freely placeable delivery area.

Food: Wheat, barley, sorghum Product: Eggs Pallets of eggs appear next to the chicken coop. Put them in your car with a forklift and sell them at a selling station or deliver them to your production buildings.

Food: Grass, hay, silage, and TMR Product: Milk, manure, and slurry Different breeds of cows provide a different amount of milk and also achieve a different selling price. Brown-Swiss and Holstein cows are used for dairy farming while Angus and Limousin are only bred for profit. Total Mixed Ration (TMR) is the best food for cows and will maximize their milk production.

Food: Hay, oat and sorghum Horses are trained and then sold for a profit. When you buy a horse it is given a name automatically. You can change its name in the animal menu. Each horse also has an individual fitness level. The higher the fitness level, the higher the value. Raise their fitness level by riding them.

Food: Corn, wheat, barley, canola, sunflowers, soybeans, potatoes, sorghum and sugar beets. Product: Manure and slurry If you take care of your pigs, they will reproduce. Then they can be sold for a profit.

Food: Grass and hay Product: Wool In order to sell the wool, you have to grab the pallet at the sheep pasture with a pallet fork and transport it to the spinnery or bring it to your own production point for further processing.

An additional option to selling your product is to place or purchase factories. Here you can process your product further to increase the selling price of the end product. This can be sold at selling points. Refer to the prices overview to find the most profitable purchaser.

On the finance screen, you can see all income and expenditures for the current day and the previous 4 months. The loan you have taken from the bank is also displayed here. If you need more money urgently, you can take loans from the bank in increments of $CURRENCY_SYMBOL5000. However, at the end of each day, you will have to pay any excess interest on the loans you have taken out.

To sell your products, you need to load your products onto a trailer and drive to one of the selling points marked on the map. Open the prices window to see what each station accepts and at what price. Ideally, you want to sell your products at the highest paying station.

Greenhouses need water to produce lettuce, tomatoes and strawberries. These goods can be sold at different selling points or processed further. You can place an supplementary watertank next to your greenhouse to increase the water capacity.

Fields that are not yours are owned by other farmers. They take care of their fields but are always in need of assistance. In the contracts menu you can find different jobs. They can lend you any tools you need, but always use your own to earn a bonus. You can cooperate with other players in multiplayer mode to complete these jobs.

The prices of all sellable commodities change constantly in accordance with supply and demand. You can influence prices by deciding what you want to put up for sale and how much of it.
If, for example, you only sell wheat for several deliveries, demand will go down considerably and the price will fall accordingly. This also means that prices for commodities you hardly ever sell will go up much faster.

Placeable selling points make the most of your produce. Sell your products, either directly from the field or processed in your factories at one of the selling points. Refer to the build mode menu which products can be sold at which selling point.

You can purchase new vehicles and tools from the vehicle shop. Visit the shop directly via the map or press the designated key to open the shop menu at any time. Equipment is divided into categories or brands. If there is a suggested combination for the vehicle or tool you can select this with a simple button press.

Certain vehicles can be customized when bought. Each of them has different customization possibilities. To customize them later, bring the vehicle to the marked area in front of the shop, then interact with the shop symbol. Note that not every vehicle or tool allows for every customization.

Over time, your vehicles and tools will deteriorate. Vehicles in need of repair lose speed or engine power.
Take the vehicle to the shop or to your vehicle workshop to pay for repairs. To fix traces of use in the paintwork, repaint your vehicle.

You also have the possibility to lease vehicles and tools instead of buying them. In order to do so, you can go to the shop and choose lease instead of buy. You will be asked to pay a starting fee, then you will be charged by the hour. The price you pay is linked to the customizations you select. Note that you can not customize a vehicle after leasing it.

For an easy way to start out you can find all the necessary tools and vehicles in here. You want to start a potato farm, but are not sure which tools you need? Look no further. In case you want to start your own animal breeding, the tools are all there. The only thing you need is the correct paddock or barn.
Always keep an eye on the 'used vehicle sale'. You can find great offers on all kinds of tools and vehicles for reduced prices.

You will see all the vehicles you currently own in the garage section. All of your assets are listed here and you can sell them directly from this menu. Their current value depends on their age and usage. In front of the shop is a marked area where you can park vehicles and tools in order to sell them. Anything you sell this way nets you 20% on top of the selling price since you went to the trouble of driving the vehicle or tool all the way to the shop.

To start off as a farmer, you need to purchase land, as you can only work on farmlands you own. You cannot cut down trees, create new fields or build placeables on other people’s land. To buy a new parcel, go to the map overview menu, switch to the farmland screen and select the field you want to buy.

In Farming Simulator 22 there are 16 types of crops: Wheat, barley, canola, sorghum, sunflowers, soybeans, corn, oat, oilseed radish, potatoes, sugar beet, poplars, sugarcane, cotton, grapes and olives. There are 3 mandatory steps to process field crops: Cultivating, sowing and harvesting.

Use a plow, cultivator, disc harrow, power harrow, subsoiler or spader to aerate the ground before you start sowing your crops. Keep in mind that when using a disc harrow you have less time to remove weeds as they are sprouting much faster. The implement needs to be lowered to work the soil.

Another possibility to bring out your seeds is direct seeding. Applying this process saves you one step, cultivating. You can use direct seeding machines to save some time, but always keep in mind that this creates weeds faster than cultivating the ground beforehand.

When crops are ready to be harvested, use a combine harvester with a suitable header attached. Unfold the harvester and if necessary, the header as well. Turn on the harvester and collect your crop. Unload your harvest into a trailer for transport. It can then be sold at a selling point, stored in your silo for later use or processed at a suitable production point.

You can sow crops using a seeder or a planter. Fill the machine with seeds from a pallet or silo first. Select the crop you want to sow. Lower the machine and turn it on. Keep the crop calendar in mind if you are playing with seasonal growth turned on. Seed pallets can be purchased at the shop. Silos can be placed on your farmland via the build mode menu. Some seeders can cultivate, sow and fertilize the field in one go. Check the shop descriptions of the tools to find out more about their attributes.

When you harvest wheat, barley, or oat you can set your harvester to create straw swaths. Straw swaths can be packed into bales by using a baler. Alternatively, straw can be picked up by forage wagons. You can sell it directly, use it as bedding for cows or use it as a component for Total Mixed Ration.

There are many ways you can take care of your field to increase its yield: Spread fertilizer twice (+23% each time), spread lime every three harvests (+15%) and using a mulcher on stubble (+5%). And to avoid a 35% yield malus, you have to remove weeds (otherwise -20%) and use a plow after root crops such as corn, potatoes, sugar beets and sugar cane (otherwise -15%).

You can buy liquid and solid fertilizer in a tank or bigbag from the shop or load it directly from a silo. Digestate can be produced by delivering silage to the biogas plant. You can also use manure and slurry from your animals.
You can also buy lime and herbicide as pallets at the shop or at different pre-placed silos around the map. Furthermore there are silos that can be placed via the build mode menu.

Using a mulcher on stubble increase your yield by 5%. Another set of tool that helps you improve your yield are rollers. Grass rollers push small stones back into the ground and provide you with one stage of fertilization. Rollers for fields also remove small stones and furthermore increase your yield by 5%.

There are three methods to remove weeds: spraying herbicide, using a weeder or using a hoe. Weeders only remove the smallest weeds, so you need to be quick. With a hoe you are able to remove small and larger weeds while with a sprayer even the largest weeds can be removed. But there might still be some left standing when you only start spraying when the weeds have fully grown.

When cultivating and ploughing your fields, there is always the possibility of stones being dug up. Be careful, when driving over them with your tools and vehicles, as they can get damaged. Smaller stones can be removed with a roller while bigger stones need to be collected. Use a stonepicker to collect the stones on your fields and sell them at the debris crusher.

The resulting logs can be delivered and sold to the sawmill or processed at a production point. The price of wood not only depends on the length but also on the straightness of the delivered pieces. Small, bent pieces will generally sell for less than long straight ones.
If you cut the tree with a chainsaw, you will need to remove small branches manually. The tree harvester can do it in one go.

New trees do not just pop up by themselves, they need to be planted with a specialized tree planter. Purchase a pallet of either pine or poplar saplings from the shop and load it onto the Damcon PL 75 tree planter. Pine trees can be planted almost anywhere and will take a while to grow. Plant the poplars on a field and harvest them with a forage harvester and a specialized header once they are fully grown.
After cutting down a tree, the remaining stump can be removed with a stump grinder.

You can also chop up logs with a wood chipper to make wood chips and deliver them to the sawmill or the biomass heating plant. You can harvest poplars with the help of a forage harvester and a specialized header together with a trailer to obtain a whole lot of woodchips.

1) Required power: Shows the required engine power to operate the tool properly.
2) Capacity: Shows how much produce the tool can contain.
3) Weight: Shows how heavy the tool is.

4) Width: Shows the working width of the tool.
5) Speed: Shows the maximum speed when working with the tool.
6) Bales: Shows the type and size of bales the tool can transport, wrap or create.

7) Fruits: Shows which fruits the tool can transport or process.
8) Seeds: Shows the type of fruits the tool can sow.
9) Animals: Shows which type and the amount of animals the tool can transport.

1) Age: Shows how many days you have owned the vehicle/tool
2) Operating hours: Shows the operating hours of the vehicle/tool (based on real time)
3) Condition: Shows the overall condition of your tool/vehicle

4) Leasing cost: Shows the amount you need to pay for leasing
5) Sell price: Shows the amount of money you will receive when selling the vehicle/tool

The icons in the shop and garage have different meanings. If you find yourself lost, you can find an explanation below:
1) Engine power: Shows the power of the engine.
2) Gearshift: Shows which sort of gearbox the vehicle uses.

3) Fuel tank: Shows the maximum capacity of the fuel tank and which fuel (diesel, biomethane or electricity) the vehicle needs.
4) Speed: Shows the maximum speed the vehicle can achieve.

5) Capacity: Shows how much the vehicle tank can contain.
6) Weight: Shows how heavy the vehicle is.

7) Width: Shows the working width of the vehicle.
8) Fruits: Shows which fruits the vehicle can harvest.
Do you need a new shed or want to expand your husbandries? Use the build mode to create your dream farm.
In case you want to change the landscape, you can find the necessary tools in this menu as well.
You also find production buildings and selling points here as well as decorative items.
Need some new boots or a fresh pair of trousers? Want to change your haircut or want to put on some sunglasses? Not a problem.
At the start of a new game and during the game you can change the appearance of your character.
Just go to your farmhouse and change your appearance any time you want.

You can set filters to adjust which vehicles, tools and points of interest are shown.
1) Vehicles such as tractors, trucks, or cars 2) Harvesters 3) Tippers, tanks, and trailers 4) Tools such as cultivators, plows, or tedders. 5) Tip places and selling stations. 6) Contract transport and delivery points. 7) General buildings and locations.

There is also an overview showing the selling stations and your machinery. Select an icon to either reset your machinery if it is stuck, teleport yourself to a place of interest or create a visual mark at a location.
You can check the state of your fields, in the map overview. You can see crop types of each field, growth status and soil composition. You can set filters to adjust this overview to your liking.
Small objects, such as logs, can be picked up by hand and either dropped or thrown. A grabbing hand icon will appear in the middle of your screen if you focus on an object that can be lifted.

When transporting large objects like tree trunks or bales it is important to secure your cargo. Some trailers allow you to fasten tension belts in order to transport the objects safely. Once you have loaded your cargo you can fasten all tensions belts directly from your vehicle's controls. Alternatively, you can fasten each belt manually by standing to the side of the trailer next to your cargo. A light green outline will show you where the tension belt can be fastened.

The train is available as any other vehicle but you will need to rent it at one of the train stations for an hourly cost. You can use it to load a lot more of your products and move it across the map and sell it. Keep in mind that you cannot transport animals, grapes, olives, grass, chaff, silage, milk, sugarcane, stones, manure or slurry.

"Deliver" jobs create a simple task to bring the previously loaded product to an unloading station. A suitable station needs to be selected in the menu. You can also set this job to looping, which means the worker keeps on delivering as long as it is possible. "Load and Deliver" combines several tasks into one. The worker fills the vehicle at a selected loading station, with the requested product. Furthermore you can select the unloading station to which the product needs to be transported. And finally, you can make this a "Looping" job, which means that as long as the selected product is available, the worker will continue doing this task.

There are several different jobs: "GoTo", "Load and Deliver", "Deliver" and "Fieldwork". Certain jobs like "Deliver" as well as "Load and Deliver" can only be selected if the vehicle has a trailer attached or has an internal tank. After having selected the vehicle and the job, you can set the target position. Click on the map to set where the worker is supposed to go and you can then adjust the orientation the vehicle is parked in once it reaches its destination.

Working a farm can be a busy job. You can hire workers to help you with some of the work. To do this click on the steering wheel icon in the menu, which opens the "Active worker" screen. In the "Active worker" sceen, you can create differnt jobs. To do this, first select one of your vehicle icons on the map, then click on "Create Job". In the menu on the right, you can select what sort of job you want to create.

"GoTo" jobs are very basic and send the worker to a certain position on the map. "Fieldwork" jobs send a helper to harvest or work a field. Keep in mind that the appropriate tool needs to be attached.

If a certain task cannot be performed, you will be informed about this by an exclamation mark next to the problematic option and a short message. Once everything is set to your liking, hit the "Start Job" button. You can see the active workers in a list view with the job and the current activity displayed.
The seasonal crop calendar impacts the time frame you are able to plant and harvest your crops.
Without the seasonal crop calendar you can plant and harvest anytime. Nevertheless, the growth time of each crop remains the same. Keep in mind that prices fluctuate depending on the time of year.

The forecast affects your decisions. While there is snow or rain, you cannot harvest your crops and will have to wait until it stops. Keep an eye on the weather forecast icon in the top right corner. When 2 weather icons are displayed, the right one will show you what the weather will be like in 6 hours.
Careful on those slippery roads, better get your winter equipment ready. Be quick and spread some road salt or use a snowplough to clear the roads.
Snow can be toggled on and off and impacts the handling of your vehicles.
Oilseed radish is a special crop, as you do not harvest it. It will be used as fertilizer, a so-called catch crop.
Once the plants are visible, you can use a cultivator and dig the plant into the soil. It is a green manure and increases your yield for your next harvest.
Once the hopper is full, you have to unload the bale. Special equipment is needed to haul it to a selling station or production point to process it any further.
For sowing cotton, you need a planter. Fill it either from a seed pallet or from the silo.
To harvest cotton, you have to use a self-propelled cotton harvester.

To gain the full yield, you need to mulch, cultivate, and fertilize between the rows. Special tools are found in the grape/olive technology tab of the shop. Once the grass is growing high, use the mulcher to keep the space between the rows clear. Cultivate after with the Disc-O-Vigne V, and fertilize.

Grape vines and olive groves are planted in rows. Use build mode to place the plants. Place a row by clicking on free space on your land to put down a pole/tree. Then, you just drag the vine/grove across the field and put down another pole/tree to finish the row. Repeat this process to set up your orchards.

Once grown, harvest your olives/grapes with the special New Holland tools, and take them to your production plant, or sell them. Remember to prune the grape vines after the harvest with the leaf cutter to prepare them for the next season, allowing them to grow anew. This step is not required for olives.

Grass, hay and straw can also be pressed into bales. Arrange the swaths first with a windrower for easy pickup. Once pressed into square or round bales, collect them with the bale loading equipment to transport them to your farm or a selling station.

To make grass, hay, or straw collecting easier, it is recommended to arrange it into rows by using a windrower. Grass can be collected with a forage wagon or made into grass bales using a baler. When using Bonsilage in your forage wagon while collecting gras or in your harvester when cutting, the yield is increased by 5%.

Grass can be cut with a mower, which is usually attached to a tractor. Feed it directly to your animals, sell it at a selling station or let it ferment into silage by putting it into a clamp silo or by wrapping it into a silage bale.

After the grass is cut, use a tedder to turn the cut grass around so it can dry properly into hay. Hay looks slightly brighter and less saturated than cut grass. Hay can be used to feed your animals directly or as part of Total Mixed Ration (TMR). If you do not own any animals, you can sell your hay at a selling station as well.

Chaff is made by chopping crops or picking up windrows using a forage harvester and a suitable header. You can cut down corn, wheat, barley, grass, sunflowers, soybeans, oat or canola – even if they aren’t fully grown. Forage harvesters do not have a grain tank; therefore, a trailer needs to be attached or has to be driven next to the forage harvester by another vehicle. Filling bonsilage into the forage harvester increases the yield by another 5%.

The resulting silage can be picked up with a front loader equipped with a silage fork or shovel and can be dumped into a mixer wagon, unloaded at a barn with feeding robot or directly into a feeding trough. Silage bales created by wrapping grass bales can be handled like fermented silage.

To turn chaff or grass into silage, you have to dump it into a bunker silo (at the biogas plant or in one of your own silos), compact the heap by repeatedly driving over it with an appropriate vehicle and cover the silo to start the fermenting process. The silo has to be filled at least 10% to close the cover.

For silage production you need to either transport chaff or grass to the biogas plant or ferment it in your own silo. If you do not own a silo yet, you can place different sized ones via the build mode menu. When placing silos, additionally placed silos use a ‘snapping feature’ to fit next to previously placed ones. This ‘snapping’ only works when the silos are empty.

Growing potatoes and sugar beet require special sowing machines and harvesters. The easiest and fastest way of harvesting potatoes or sugar beets is to use a self-propelled harvester. However, a machine like this is quite costly and likely to exceed your budget early on. Remember, you can always lease a vehicle.

A cheaper alternative is to use a tractor with several specialized tools. This basically works in two steps: Once the plants are fully grown, you have to cut the foliage with a haulm topper, like the Grimme KS 75-4. Afterwards, the crop can be picked up with a trailed harvester, like the Grimme EVO 290.

The sugarbeet cutter is used to chop sugarbeets. You can find the tool under frontloader tools. The resulting cut sugarbeets can be brought to a biogas plant to be fermented into silage or delivered to the sugar mill production point to produce sugar.
Sugarcane differs from typical field and root crops. It needs more time to mature but it also cannot wither. You need special sowing and harvesting equipment for sugarcane.
Sugarcane grows comparably slow, but it does not wither. Harvested sugarcane will grow back after a while and can be harvested again.

To harvest sugarcane, you will need a sugarcane harvester. It removes the top leaves and cuts the thick sugarcane stalks into small, compact pieces. Just like forage harvesters, sugarcane harvesters do not have their own tank, and these need to be accompanied with a tipper/trailer in the field.

To sow sugarcane you will need a billet planter like the Gessner Single Row Billet Planter. As with potatoes, the machines can be filled with sugarcane stalks from the last harvest. You can tip the stalks directly into the billet planter with a tipper/trailer or make use of a telehandler or wheel loader with a shovel attached to fill the machine. You can start to plant sugarcane even without sugarcane stalks. Simply purchase a pallet of sugarcane in the shop and fill the billet planter with it.

As sugarcane regrows, tillage is nearly unnecessary. If you play with 'periodic plowing required', the ground must be aerated after 3 harvests to secure a full yield. The best results are achieved with a subsoiler like the KUHN DC 401, but a plow will be sufficient as well. After loosening the ground, you can plant new stalks of sugarcane.

During harvest, specialized sugarcane tippers/trailers are commonly used as they have a higher tip height, allowing them to tip the sugarcane stalks directly into a truck to guarantee a quick transport. Sugarcane cannot be stored in silos, however, it can be tipped anywhere on the ground and stored there. You can process it further in your sugarmill, which can be placed in build mode.
To earn money, you need to sell what you produce (crops, animals, and their products).
When it rains or hails you can't harvest crops, you must wait until the weather improves.
Don't know how to do something? Check the Help section in the Pause menu.
You can increase the yield of your harvest by fertilizing and spraying your fields after sowing.
If your animals have water, food, and a clean stable, you can soon expect offspring.
Pigs can eat nearly everything - corn, wheat, barley, canola, sunflowers, soybeans, potatoes, and sugar beet.
Grass is cut with a mower, which is usually attached to a tractor. Afterward, you can use a tedder to turn the cut grass over and dry it to make hay.
Horses need hay, water, and oat to be happy.
Ride your horses to train them. By training them, their value increases.
Using a bale wrapper, you can turn grass bales into silage bales.
To earn money, you need to sell what you produce (crops, wood, animals, and their products).
When you are harvesting your crops while it is raining, your yield is lowered. Best wait until the weather improves.
If a vehicle or tool gets stuck, you can reset it on the map overview screen to the shop parking lot.
Don't know how to do something? Check the Help section in the in-game menu.
Change your environment! You can transform a forest into fields if you want to: cut down the trees, remove the stumps and use a plow to create a field.
Note that you can carry around small pieces of wood by hand if they're not too heavy.
If your front loader is carrying something heavy, you can attach a weight to the back of the tractor to balance it out.
You can increase the yield of your harvest by fertilizing and spraying your fields after seeding.
Pigs can eat nearly everything - corn, wheat, barley, canola, sunflowers, soybeans, potatoes, sorghum and sugar beet.
If your animals have water, food, a clean stable and are old enough, you can soon expect offspring.
Some vehicles allow for additional customization, such as different wheels, a stronger engine, a different color, or a front loader attacher.
Before you can harvest potatoes or sugar beet, you must remove the foliage on top.
You can fertilize a field with manure, slurry, or manufactured fertilizer (liquid or solid).
You can buy new land for growing crops in the map menu. You can also sell land you own if necessary.
You cannot work, mow grass, or cut trees on someone else's land. You need to buy the land.

On the finance screen, you can see all the income and expenditure for the current month and previous four months. If you need more money urgently, you can borrow some from the bank in increments of $CURRENCY_SYMBOL5000.

Selling wood is a profitable business and can be a welcome change from regular fieldwork. You can cut down trees with a chainsaw or a tree harvester. They should be debranched and cut into logs before they're sold.
When selling logs, the length of a piece and its suitability for processing (straight logs are better) determines its value.
Grass is cut with a mower, which is usually attached to a tractor. Afterward, you can use a tedder to turn the cut grass over and dry it to make hay.
To make it easier to collect grass, it's best to arrange it into rows using a windrower. Grass can be collected with a forage wagon or turned into bales with a baler.
Horses need hay, water, and oats to be happy.
Ride your horses to train them. Training them increases their value.

Most of the fields on the map are owned by other farmers controlled by the computer. They take care of their fields but are always in need of assistance and can hire you as a contractor. Check the job board in the Contracts menu.
You can use a plow to create new fields on land you own.
Seeders and planters needs seeds. You can buy seed bags from the shop.
When you harvest wheat, barley, or oat, you can create straw swaths with the harvester.
Straw swaths can be packed into bales using a baler. Alternatively, straw can be collected in forage wagons. It can be used as bedding for animals or to make Total Mixed Ration (TMR).

Your cows always produce milk, but you can improve their productivity by feeding them well. The best food you can give your cow is Total Mixed Ration (TMR), which is produced by mixing hay, straw, mineral feed and silage in a mixer wagon.
New trees don't just pop up by themselves. They need to be planted with a special planting machine. The shop can provide you with seedling pallets.
You can also shred logs using a wood chipper to sell them as wood chips.
Bring your vehicle to the shop or to your vehicle workshop for repairs.
If your vehicle is dirty, use a high pressure washer to clean it.

To harvest cotton, you must use a self-propelled cotton harvester. When the harvester tank is full, you must unload the large bale of cotton. You need a special trailer to transport it to the selling station.
Table is being lowered. Please wait...
Table is being tilted. Please wait...
Frame is being lifted. Please wait...
Frame is being lowered. Please wait...
The bunkersilo is not empty. All content will be removed too.
Time until fully charged: %d Minutes %d Seconds (%d%%)

Please reload your current progress from the main menu to use the newly installed downloadable content.
There is no more storage space for the product.

Chickens provide you with eggs, which can be sold at a selling point or processed in your factories.
Cows provide you with milk and can be sold for profit.
This type is mainly used for breeding.
This type is mainly used for dairy farming.
Horses need to be ridden to increase their value. They allow you to explore the map in an alternative way.
Pigs can be sold for profit. They produce organic fertilizer which helps your crops grow.
Sheep provide you with wool which can be sold directly or processed further in your factories.

Animal type does not support unloading!
You don't have enough space in your husbandries!

Scroll the mouse wheel or press 1 or 2 on the keyboard to switch chainsaws.
Would you like to buy this land for %s?
You cannot sell this animal for the time being.
You cannot sell this land while you still own placeable objects on it. You have to sell these objects first.

No endorsement or affiliation is intended between Stadia and the manufacturers of non-Stadia controllers or consoles. STADIA, the Stadia beacon, Google, and related marks and logos are trademarks of Google LLC. All other trademarks are the property of their respective owners.
Le Jardin des Fermiers Farm Shop

Horses require straw for a clean bedding, water, and food (consisting of 50% hay and 50% oat) to stay healthy. They should ride out every day to increase their fitness. Periodically they need to be brushed down and cleaned. A horse's value is determined by its fitness, health, and cleanliness.
Animals always need water! They also require a clean feeding area and some require straw. The food mixture consists of:
The higher the LOD, the greater the distance at which high quality models are rendered, improving overall visual quality. Lowering this value can improve performance.
If turned on, the indoor camera follows the movement of the seat suspension and gives a more realistic feeling.
Show the controls information box in the top left section of the screen.
Sets the interval of the autosave function.
Whether or not the vehicles' engines are started/stopped automatically upon entering/exiting a vehicle.
Set the brigthness of the game.
Activate or deactivate the swaying of the characters head when moving around.
Vehicle outdoor camera will automatically zoom in when detecting an interfering object.
Adjusts the quality of the clouds.
Switches colors of crops and field states on the map view to make it easier to recognize hues for red/green color blindness.
Defines if the vehicle direction change is automatically toggled or manually by pressing a button.
The speed at which your machinery becomes dirty.

Nvidia Deep Learning Super Sampling. Renders the scene at a lower resolution and upscales the image to the display resolution using Nvidia DLSS. Lowering this value can improve performance, especially with high display resolutions.
Turns on the simplified controls for cranes.
The economic difficulty affects the buying and selling prices. Also, the revenue of contracts is based on this factor.
Amount of time you need to fertilize your fields for maximum yield.

FidelityFX Super Resolution. Renders the scene at a lower resolution and upscales the image to the display resolution using FidelityFX SR. Lowering this value can improve performance, especially with high display resolutions.
Set whether a specific month should always be visible. Turn off for dynamic visuals.
Adjusts how far into the distance foliage (crops, bushes) will be rendered. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Intensity of force feedback on compatible devices.
Decrease or increase the maximum area that you can see.
Whether or not vehicles destroy crops when you drive over them.
Sets how much fuel is consumed by your machinery.
This setting changes the gear shift mode of vehicles with a manual transmission.
Select the general graphics settings. This can be adjusted further in Advanced Graphics Settings.
Activate or deactivate head or eye trackiing devices.
Show glowing icons in the world with information specific to some locations.
Whether or not the AI worker automatically refills all fertilizer he distributes. Will increase AI worker cost.
Whether or not the AI worker automatically refills all fuel he consumes. Will increase AI worker cost.
Whether or not the AI worker automatically refills all manure he distributes. Buying will increase AI worker cost.
Whether or not the AI worker automatically refills all seed he sows. Will increase AI worker cost.
Whether or not the AI worker automatically refills all slurry he distributes. Buying will increase AI worker cost.
Defines which value is visualized in the speedometer.
Set which input controls are displayed.
Trains are accessible when switching vehicles.
Select the language for the game.
Adjusts the range and number of lights used for vehicles and buildings. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Whether or not you need to spread lime on your fields periodically to keep yield high.
Sets amount of mirrors displayed in game. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Adjusts the amount of tire tracks being displayed. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Set the currency used in game.
Select the language for multiplayer games.
Multisampling anti-aliasing (MSAA) to smooth geometry edges. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Adjusts how far into the distance objects will be rendered. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Sets the number of days per month. Changes will take effect in the next season!
The time it takes for grains to grow.
Grains will wither when left on the fields for too long.
Whether or not you need to plow your fields periodically to keep yield high.
Additional Anti-aliasing option to reduce flickering and smooth geometry edges.
DLAA: Nvidia Deep Learning Anti-Aliasing is an anti-aliasing feature that uses the same pipeline as Nvidia’s DLSS, but with the upscaling portion removed.
Turn the radio on or off.
Sets where the radio can be played.
Adjusts if beacon lights are reflected on surfaces.
Remembers the camera position for each vehicle once you exit it.
Upscales or downscales the games rendered resolution.
Upscales or downscales the games rendered resolution (3D only).
Enter a name for this game save.
Turns on a growth calendar that adheres to the seasons and the withering of plants. Planting is only possible when the crop can reach maturity.
Influences details of terrain and objects. Lowering this value can improve performance.
With lower settings, some objects are rendered with a lower resolution. Lowering this value can improve performance with a minimal visual impact.
Adjusts the quality of the shadows at higher distances. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Adjusts the quality of shadows. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Defines the number of lights that can cast a shadow simultaneously. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Adjusts the resolution of the shadows. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Show yellow and black markers around interactive zones.
Snow falls on the ground and can be moved by vehicles.
Adjusts the screen space ambient occlusion quality.
Adjusts the speed at which the wheels return to the default position.
Determines if stones can appear in your fields when cultivating and plowing.
Keep the brake button held to brake and automatically start reversing once you have come to a standstill.
Adjusts how far into the distance terrain will be rendered. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Adjusts terrain details and terrain texture quality. Lowering this value can improve performance.

Improves image quality of textures. Bilinear with the lowest improvement, Trilinear with a modest improvement and Anisotropic filtering with the highest improvement. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Adjusts quality of textures. Lowering this value can improve performance.
The speed at which the time passes in game.
Allow AI traffic vehicles on roads.
Trailers can only be filled until the max. allowed weight is reached.
Adjusts the size of the user interface to fit to your screensize.
Set the area units used in the game.
Set the temperature units used in the game.
Set the distance measuring units used in game.
The vehicle camera will try to stay horizontal with the environment.
V-Sync prevents tearing, but may influence your framerate depending on your graphics processor and monitor.
Adjusts the vehicle arm turning speed.
This setting changes when your voice is sent to the other players. This can be adjusted in the keybinding settings.
Adjust the volume of the environmental sound effects.
Adjusts the volume of menu sounds.
Global audio volume. Affects all types of sound equally.
Adjusts display quality of fillVolumes and detailed objects. Lowering this value can improve performance.
Select volume of the menu music.
Adjust the volume of the music played on the radio.
Adjust the volume of the vehicle engine and machinery sounds.
Adjust the volume of the voices from other players.
Adjust the volume of your voice.
Whether or not weeds will grow in your fields.
Play game in full screen or windowed mode.
If you'd like to start the guided tour later, start a new career in Elmcreek or Haut-Beyleron and you’ll be asked again.
And that's the end of this tour! Visit the Help Menu for more in-depth information. Good luck and have fun in the world of farming!
If you’re not familiar with the basics of the game yet, we recommend taking the guided tour of Elmcreek or Haut-Beyleron.

You have enough money to start the farming business of your dreams. What will your specialty be? Arable farming, breeding livestock, forestry or a bit of everything? The choice is yours!
First, buy some land, buildings and the necessary tools.
Then sell your products and expand your farm!

You only have enough money to start a small farm.
First, buy some land, buildings and the necessary tools.
Then sell your products and expand your farm!

OK! Attach the harvester's header that's sitting right in front of it.
The help panel in the top left corner always shows you the functions that are currently available.
This is one of the fields you own from the very start. Its wheat has conveniently grown to a stage where it can be harvested. Time for you to enter this combine harvester and get started!

The helper will now take care of this job until they are done or the grain tank of the harvester is full. You can now take care of other business. Exit the harvester and walk to the next exclamation mark symbol indicated on the map.

To your left at the edge of your field is a big green harvester. Head over there and touch the exclamation mark icon next to it.
In the lower left is your map. The large blue diamond icon indicates where the exclamation mark is located.

Now you're all set to harvest! Drive forward into the wheat. You can either adjust your vehicle's speed manually or use the cruise control to maintain a constant speed.
The maximum speed you can drive is automatically determined by the vehicle and attached tool you are using.

So far so good! Usually, however, you'll have a lot to do, so it makes sense to hire helpers on your farm.
Whenever a job can be executed by a helper, it will be indicated in the top left panel. Hire a helper to take care of the rest of the field.
Good! Now unfold the harvester and turn it on so the header starts rotating.
Well done! That's enough for now. Hire another helper to finish this job.

Fields that have been harvested need to be cultivated before they can be sown anew. This field has been harvested recently and now needs somebody to cultivate it. Enter the tractor and attach the cultivator that's placed behind it.

Let's switch to one of the other tractors. Using the switching feature you can quickly cycle through all of your vehicles.
Do this until you reach the tractor with the next exclamation mark right beside it. Then get out and touch it.
Now lower the cultivator and drive over the field to cultivate its soil.
Fields that have been cultivated are ready to be sown. For this you need to use a sowing machine. Get back in the tractor and attach the sowing machine that's placed behind it.

Nice! You've got the hang of that. You can continue later if you want, or hire another helper for this job.
As you can see, it is important to know what plants can be sown each season. Consult the crop calendar in the menu any time to get an overview.
Allright, now switch to the next tractor with an exclamation mark icon next to it.

The sowing machine you just attached is already filled with seeds. Once you run out, you will have to refill it with a seed bag bought from the shop.
Time to sow! Since it is August the only crop that can be sown at this time of year is canola. Change the seed type visible in the lower right of the screen 3 times until you have canola selected (The canola icon looks like a little yellow flower). Then turn on and lower the sowing machine and drive over the field.

Drive next to the harvester on its left-hand side until your trailer is alongside it and open the cover of your trailer. The pipe will start extending and if you are in the correct position, the wheat will start pouring out automatically.

Nicely done! Selling your crops is the main way to earn money as a farmer.
Let's drive over to the shop, where the final exclamation mark icon is located. The flashing diamond indicates it on your map once again.
As soon as the harvester's tank is full (or even before that), you can unload its contents into a trailer. Hop on the tractor and attach the trailer to it.
This unloading station is one of the places on the map where you can sell your harvest. You can check the current prices of all products by opening the menu and going to the prices screen.
Move the tractor so the trailer is located right over the pit. As soon as the unload symbol appears at the bottom of the screen, you can unload the wheat and sell it.
Great! Wheat is being dumped into your trailer. Wait until it is done and then drive your tractor with the trailer to the spot indicated on the map and touch the exclamation mark there.

This is where you can sell your vehicles and tools or buy new equipment. You can either visit the shop in person by activating the shopping symbol in front of it or trigger it anywhere by pressing the button shown below.
Welcome to Farming Simulator! Would you like to start a short guided tour? This will show you the basics of the game.

You already own some land and equipment. The economy is profitable and gameplay elements are on an easy setting.
A real challenge! The economy is tough, prices are low and you've already taken out hefty credit with the bank. Gameplay elements are on the most realistic setting.

The standard setting for getting started. You don't own any land but have some substantial funds ready for spending. The economy is stable, grain prices are decent and gameplay elements are on the standard settings.

Player '%s' wants to sleep. Accept request?
What time do you want to wake up?

This is your home. After eight o'clock at night, you can come here to sleep until morning.
Note that your AI workers also rest and will not work during this time. They’ll resume work in the morning.
It’s better to finish all your work before you sleep because the crops continue to grow and could even spoil if they’re in their final growth stage during this time.
